alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 3:44AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...SNOW AND POTENTIAL WINTRY MIX OF PRECIPITATION EXPECTED ACROSS BRISTOL BAY, THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA, AND MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY TODAY THROUGH MONDAY... Two active storm systems and their associated fronts will continue to bring winter weather across Southwest Alaska. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches are expected for much of the Southwest as the second front tracks north today, with higher totals possible near the Kuskokwim Mountains. Snow may continue to mix with freezing rain or transition to rain, leading to lower snowfall totals. Some uncertainty remains regarding how and where this transition will set up. Current thinking places the transition zone from Dillingham to King Salmon and then Goodnews Bay to Sleetmute, with rain further south. Any wintry mix is expected to be brief with minimal ice accumulations. As cold air returns behind the low later today, precipitation will begin gradually transitioning back to snow from west to east. Another low pressure system will move into the Southwest from Sunday into Monday, sending warmer air north once again with the potential for several more inches of snow and possible mixed precipitation.
